level.text: All persons who desire assistance under the Program shall submit applications to the Director in a form prescribed by the Director.
Each application for assistance shall be accompanied by proof of ownership of the property by the eligible senior citizen which shall consist of a notarized copy of:
A recorded land installment contract or purchase contract; or
Other title documents, purchase or sales contracts that the Director finds acceptable.
The Director shall review each application for completeness and compliance with eligibility standards.
The Director shall reject applicants who are determined to be ineligible for the Program.
The Director may reject applications that are incomplete.
The approval or disapproval of applications shall be the sole decision of the Director. The Director shall notify all applicants in writing of the final decision regarding application approval.
Each applicant shall agree to permit inspections of the property to identify work items and other inspections as DHCD deems necessary.
In approving each application, the DHCD Director may take into consideration applications for DHCD grant programs that are complementary to the Senior Citizens’ Home Repair and Improvement Program.
